bcl:section.bcl:text: Nothing in this Part affects the application of Part 3 to a fur farm on which mink are kept or dealt with.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person must not engage in mink-related work on a fur farm unless the person is vaccinated.

A licensed fur farmer must ensure that a person does not engage in mink-related work on the fur farm unless the licensed fur farmer, or a person responsible for managing the day-to-day operations of the fur farm, confirms that the person is vaccinated by reviewing the person's proof of vaccination.
Despite subsections (1) and (2), a person who is engaged in mink-related work on the fur farm on or before January 1, 2022, is not required to be vaccinated until that date.
A licensed fur farmer must make a vaccination status record in accordance with subsection (2) with respect to each person who engages in mink-related work on the fur farm.
A vaccination status record must include all of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person's full legal name;
the date on which the person began to engage in mink-related work;
the date on which the person is confirmed to be vaccinated.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On or before April 30, 2022, a licensed fur farmer must give to the chief veterinarian a copy of the vaccination status record.
For the purposes of determining compliance with section 11.3, an inspector may do one or more of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: require the licensed fur farmer to produce a copy of the vaccination status record;
require a person found to be engaging in mink-related work on the fur farm to produce the person's proof of vaccination for review by the inspector;
disclose to the chief veterinarian

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the names of persons found to be engaging in mink-related work on the fur farm, and
the results of reviews performed under paragraph (b) with respect to those persons.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Personal protective equipment for mink-related work

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person must not engage in mink-related work on a fur farm unless the person is wearing both

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: eye protection in the form of goggles, and
a mask intended for medical purposes that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: covers the user's nose and mouth, and
provides a physical barrier to fluids and particulate materials.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A licensed fur farmer must ensure that a person does not engage in mink-related work on the fur farm unless the person is wearing both eye protection and a mask in accordance with subsection (1).
A licensed fur farmer must not do any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: breed mink kept on the fur farm;
allow mink kept on the fur farm to breed;
bring new mink to the fur farm.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A licensed fur farmer must immediately slaughter any kits born on the fur farm.
A licensed fur farmer must ensure that all records made under this Part are kept together with the licensed fur farmer's health management plan

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the form and manner required by the chief veterinarian, and
for a period of at least 10 years.
